text.__SUMMARY__: Atractaspis battersbyi, or Battersby's burrowing asp, is a species of venomous snake in the family Atractaspididae.
text.Etymology: Both the common name and the specific epithet, battersbyi, are in honor of James Clarence Battersby (1901–1993), herpetologist at the British Museum (Natural History) for 45 years.
text.Geographic range: A. battersbyi is endemic to Africa. It is found in the Central African countries of Congo and Democratic Republic of Congo.
text.Further reading: de Witte GF (1959). "Contribution à la faune herpétologique du Congo Belge. Description de trois serpents nouveaux ". Rev. Zool. Bot. Africaines 50 (3/4): 348-351. (Atractaspis battersbyi, new species, p. 350). (in French).
